```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
```
Here I will read in the data

```{r}
ucsb_grad <- read_csv(here("data", "ucsb_grad_data.csv"))
```

ggplot displaying year versus domestic UCSB college enrollment (ggplot(data = ucsb_grad)) with ethnicity filling col by color (geom_col(aes(fill = ethnicity)))

```{r}
ggplot(data = ucsb_grad, aes(x = year_abbr, y = domestic_enrollment)) +
  geom_col(aes(fill = ethnicity), position = "fill") +
  labs(x = "Year", y = "Domestic Graduate Enrollment", title = "Proportional Domestic UCSB Graduate Enrollment by Ethnicity in Terms of Year") + #In addition to x and y-axises, added a title labs()
  theme_minimal() #Changed theme to minimal (theme_minim)

```
